title: Martin Scorsese’s ‘The Irishman’ Gets a Trailer
text:
Martin Scorsese’s long-awaited mob movie, The Irishman, tracks three men through decades of their lives, going back as far as the 1950s. Al Pacino, Robert De Niro, and Joe Pesci all went under the CGI knife to play their characters when they were young. We’ve been disappointed by CGI mustaches and CGI lions. Can CGI film icons do us wrong? The official trailer for the 209 minute film (over 3 hours!) premiered on The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon, giving us a real good look at Robert De Niro’s computer face as he gets more and more involved with the mob and as his scowl gets more and more ingrained. “It was like the army,” he says in a voice-over. “You follow orders, you get rewarded.” Is that the case for when you’re asked to assassinate a union leader? We’re not so confident, but at least he can make jokes about it. The Netflix film is an epic look at organized crime throughout history; it took on a massive visual-effects project, and soon enough, you’ll get to watch it on your 13-inch laptop screen. Netflix is releasing The Irishman in theaters for an obligatory 26 days before sharing it online–just enough time to make the Oscars requirements, but not enough time for a wide release.

What Netflix does with The Irishman will probably affect its other buzzy movies from big-name directors that could have awards-season play: Steven Soderbergh’s Panama Papers movie The Laundromat, David Michôd’s Timothée Chalamet drama The King, Dee Rees’s Anne Hathaway–Willem Dafoe adaptation The Last Thing He Wanted, Fernando Meirelles’s The Pope, and Noah Baumbach’s A Marriage Story starring Scarlett Johansson and Adam Driver.
description: Martin Scorsese’s star-studded “The Irishman” gets its first official trailer, featuring stars Joe Pesci, Al Pacino, Robert De Niro, all CGI de-aged and ready to fight.
